byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and an Iraqi employee of The New York Times from Tikrit.

abstract: Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi says security troops have retaken Tikrit, yet reports from people in city say Islamic State forces still remain; American-led military coalition airstrikes subsided, possibly to allow ground forces to advance.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi said government forces had reached the center of Tikrit, which some took to mean a declaration of victory. But Islamic State forces still hold parts of the city.

headline.main: Iraqi Claims That ‘Tikrit Has Fallen’ Is Disputed
headline.print_headline: Shades of Meaning in Iraqi Claims That ‘Tikrit Has Fallen’

snippet: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi said government forces had reached the center of Tikrit, which some took to mean a declaration of victory. But Islamic State forces still hold parts of the city.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
